noun.description: A building in which objects of historical, scientific, artistic, or cultural interest are stored and exhibited.
examples: the museum is noted for its fine fossil collection
it is difficult to avoid the feeling that the city is now a living museum

origin: Early 17th century (denoting a university building, specifically one erected at Alexandria by Ptolemy Soter): via Latin from Greek mouseion seat of the Muses, based on mousa muse.
